1.content:
Now, like I said in the intro to this interactive story, there are 3 Divisions within the Imperial Assault Force.

First, there is the Imperial Assault Force–Flower Division. Formed on New Year's Day in 1922, the Flower Division is hidden underneath a theater in the heart of Ginza, Tokyo called The Grand Imperial Theater. Here, the women of Flower Division live and work undercover as actors performing theatrical plays under the alias "Imperial Opera Troupe". The reasoning behind this is both spiritual and mental: song and dance are considered to be traditional methods that could suppress evil, and the stage was likened to a battlefield where self-confidence is built.

Then, there is the Paris Assault Force, which is located in–you guessed it: Paris, France. When the Imperial Assault Force went into service and had proven to be an effective means of defending Tokyo as a whole, other countries soon followed this defense method as well, including France and the United States.Like Flower Division, the Paris Assault Force placed it's base operations at a famous Parisian night club known as "The Theater Chattes Noires", under the alias "The Groupe Fleur de Paris", and this assault force was formed in 1926.

And last but not least, there is the New York Combat Revue. Formed in 1928 with Michael Sunnyside as its commander, the New York Combat Revue differs from other organizations in that their assault team is referred to as "The Star Division", and let's just say that Star Division has a bit of an interesting history. More specifically, two members of the original Star Division were transferred to this group. Like it's foreign counterparts, Star Division has it's base of operations hidden within a theater known as "The Little Lip Theater", which is located on Broadway, hence why The New York Combat Revue goes by the alias, "The New York Fighting Troupe".

Well, now that we have everything set up, it's time to choose, fellow readers! Which Division will you choose? The Flower Division? The Paris Assault Force? Or The Star Division?

So, you decided to go with the famed Flower Division, hmm? That's fine. After all, the Flower Division that the Sakura Wars series focuses much of it's attention on early in the story. Now then, here's a little more history about the Flower Division:

On New Year's Day in 1922, the Imperial Assault Force was the successor to the Imperial Army's Counter-Demon Team. One of the members of that original team, Lieutenant General Ikki Yoneda, commanded the group until his retirement. By 1927, the Imperial Assault Force is composed of six official groups, all of which serve different purposes within the organization. The anti-demon attack squad, known as the Flower Division, is the division that the series focuses much of it's attention early on in the story.

Now as for the members of such an assault force, Flower Division is led by Lieutenant Junior Grade Ichiro Ogami, with Maria Tachibana acting as his vice captain. Other members of the Flower Division include Sakura Shinguji, Sumire Kanzaki, Iris Chateaubriand, Li Kohran, Kanna Kirishima, Orihime Soletta, and Reni Milchstrabe.

Other teams that play significant roles in the original storyline are the Wind Division, who are responsible for frontline support and transportation, Moon Division, who provide support within the shadows, and an unofficial group known as the Rose Division, who protect the Majinki. Now as for what sort of armor the Flower Division uses against the demons, Kanzaki Heavy Industries developed a dual-powered steam/spirit armor known as a "Koubu", only a young girl bearing high levels of spiritual power is shown to have been capable of moving the Koubu, which gave birth to the misconception that only women could operate the Koubu armor.

As the moon shone brightly in the night sky, the members of the Imperial Assault Force–Flower Division fought valiantly against the demons, clashing with these malicious soulless entities inside their individual Koubu. With Kanna using her Martial Arts and Sumire wielding her Koubu-sized Naginata with such perfected skill, Sakura fought against multiple demons with her katana, making her pink Koubu move swiftly to block, dodge, and counter every blow the monstrous creatures threw in her direction.

But then, something gigantic came out of nowhere from the right, as a giant but scrawny clawed hand swiped at Sakura, knocking both her and her Koubu in the process, slamming the mechanized suit of armor into a nearby 3-Story department store.

"SAKURA!!" Her comrades yelled, greatly concerned about their friend/sister-in-arms. Although inflicted with a powerful surprise attack, Sakura's Koubu was fortunate enough to only receive several large claw mark scratches upon her Koubu's metal hull. However, it was there that she got a good look at her unknown assailant. In appearance, it was a massive demon, as it towered over her Koubu, with enough strength to swat her like a fly, despite the Koubu's steel bulk. It had this canine-looking head, bearing sharp fangs and teeth for the world to see. On it's head were these large deer-like antlers, possibly used for ramming an opponent. It's body looked physically lean and powerful, but also scrawny and frail as well, since Sakura could see what appeared to be a ribcage underneath it's deathly skin. It's arms were long and lanky, bearing these long skeletal hands and fingers, each finger bearing a jagged claw on each fingertip, as it's arms happened to be much longer than it's digitgrade lupine legs.

If Li were here and had to make a guess, the creature must be around 16 to 17 meters in height. From there, the beastly giant let out a shrieking howl into the nightly air as it screeched, "KYYRRRRAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAHH!!!!!!!!!!!" The roar was loud enough to give Sakura a headache since she was so close to the gigantic monstrosity. But then, the beast moved it's hollow gaze toward Sakura and her Koubu, as if it wanted to devour her. "Sakura, get out of there!!" Li yelled, warning Sakura to run. However, just as she was going to quickly evade the ginormous beast, she suddenly noticed as her Koubu's right leg had suffered a devastating amount of damage, struggling to get her Koubu back up onto it's metallic feet.

But suddenly, just as the beastly creature was just about to grab her Koubu with it's lengthy right arm and hand, something equally as large rushed the antler-wielding creature, delivering a powerful blitz attack, punching the monster with a powerful left hook, sending the beast flying back several blocks, stunning it in the process, as it's body smashed through one or two buildings before being pinned to the side of a third building. "What...was that?" Sakura asked herself, just as she then looked upwards and despite the lack of environmental lighting, she was able to make out what exactly attacked the grotesque monster. And what she beared witness towards brought her in some sense of shock and awe.

The creature that now stood before her was just as gigantic in scale as the beastly creature from before, looking to be around 15 meters in height. In appearance, the giant had a very humanoid physique, complete with human-looking skin, legs, feet, arms, hands, torso, and head. However, Sakura could notice several features on the humanoid giant. First, it had the muscular physicality of an Olympic athlete, strong but lean enough to perform swift movements, despite it's sheer size and scale, complete with a set of 8-pack abdominal muscles. From there, Sakura could see it sported black hair with a streak of red on one of the left hair bangs, as the giant's hair just grazed it's broad shoulders. It had these pointy and elongated ears sticking out from the sides of it's head, just as Sakura noticed the giant's eyes were a burnt orange, glowing amongst the moonlit sky. Along with a prominent hooked nose, the giant's mouth had an unusual jagged shape to it's design, as if it was unsuited for intelligible speech whatsoever, as it's mouth sported a row of sharpened teeth upon both it's upper and lower jaws, with no signs of any facial cheeks and lips in it's physical appearance.

Shortly after exhaling a deep steamy breath, the giant then bellowed out a loud and deep guttural howl, as it's scream could be heard throughout the battlefield while it roared, "GGRRAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAH!!!!" From there, the giant sprinted toward the beastly creature, creating these thunderous footsteps in the process due to it's sheer size, making these small craters on the cobbled street. But as Orihime and her comrades saw the giant humanoid sprint past them, the antlered beast quickly regained it's footing, as it angrily charged toward the giant, sprinting on all four limbs like an animal, as these two titanic creatures clashed, both wanting their opponent to fall.

"Yoneda, are you seeing this?!" Kanna barked, speaking toward the Flower Division's commanding officer, Commander Ikki Yoneda,where he responded and answered, "Yes, Kanna. I can clearly see it on the Steamputer. Judging from it's appearance, it appears to be a Titan." From there, with the realization of what exactly they were up against....

Greeted by the morning sun, the Grand Imperial Theater and it's residents were already up and about, despite last night's peculiar events, especially when it came to their newfound ally, the Titan, now revealed to be an American named Lieutenant Captain Dalton Lincoln. Of course, the almost major damage caused from the larger-than-life battle between the Titan and the gigantic beastly creature, since several of the buildings suffered extensive structural damage.

Today, as she sported her usual clothing like her pink kimono and purple hakama, Sakura gently walked through the Theater's lavishly decorated hallways, carrying a bouquet of flowers in her arms, which were obviously a gift for her savior. Along the way, she met up with Kanna, who was also in her normal clothes, as Kanna greeted Sakura and said, "Hey, Sakura! Commander Yoneda wants everyone to meet him in his office. You gonna join us?"

"Thank you, Kanna. I will join you and the others as soon as I deliver these flowers to him." Sakura explained, obviously grateful for the Titan's assistance in their previous battle. In response, Kanna spoke to her comrade, putting a hand on her hip a little, and replied, "Oh! You mean the American, huh? Well, can't say I blame you for your generosity, Sakura. He did save our skins last night. Try not to take too long in there, alright?" From there, as she walked in the opposite direction of Sakura's current venture, Kanna patted her friend on the shoulder once or twice as a sign of trust, as Sakura spoke back to the Amazon of a woman and answered, "Don't worry, Kanna. I won't take too long."

After navigating through the halls of the Grand Imperial Theater, Sakura finally arrived at a room on the second floor, which was where the American known as Dalton Lincoln was residing in, as she opened the door and walked inside, fully aware of his current unconscious state, sleeping on the bed in nothing but his boxers and formal military pants, with his shoes, socks, shirt, and formal military coat were neatly laid out upon a nearby dresser.

"My apologies for taking so long, I had to run my way over to the marketplace to buy these flowers." She said, speaking to the unconscious American as if he was listening. From there, as she pulled out a nearby chair to sit in, she faced the side of left side of the bed and spoke once more and said, "Anyway, I just wanted to say.....Thank you. For saving us." But then, just as she was about to leave, Sakura suddenly heard a deep moaning grunt from behind, as she turned around to see that, to her surprise, that the American was starting to wake up!

But as he sat up on the bed, Dalton held the side of his head with one hand, groaning as if he had a hangover, where he then spoke up and muttered, "Uuugh, my head..... Damn, that oversized freak of nature was really obsessed on killing me." However, it was there that Dalton noticed where he was after regaining his bearings. "Wait a minute.... Where the hell am I?" He said, just as he then suddenly looked right at Sakura, causing him to quickly sprung off the bed to face her, positioning himself in a fighting stance.

"Hey, it's okay! It's okay. I'm not going to hurt you." Sakura replied, putting her hands up in a defensive stance and a sign of reassurance. However, Dalton lowered his fists and arms upon hearing her voice, recognizing it from last night, as he spoke toward the young woman and asked, "That voice..... You....you were that woman inside the metal armor, weren't you?!" Surprised to hear that he still remembered her voice, Sakura looked at him with a surprised look on her face, where she then said, "Hold on, You remembered what happened last night?!"

"Yeah, basically everything. Those demonic machines, that gigantic beast with the antlers, you, your friends, everything! Hell, I even remember your name. Sakura, was it?" Dalton answered, remembering the events from last night with clairvoyance. Of course, this made Sakura shocked a little that he even remembered when Li said her name. "Well....I guess I can say that I know you as well, Dalton Lincoln." Sakura replied, making the conversation between the two skilled individuals all the more awkward, as Dalton let out a sigh, rubbing the back of his head and remarked, "Okay, this....just gotten a little awkward. I mean, we know each other's names, for crying out loud."

Of course, Sakura couldn't help but blush a little from such an awkward moment. Both that, and from the fact that the person she was speaking to towered over her. After all, Sakura had recently grew an inch, making her 5 feet 2 inches tall, compared to her previous height of 5 foot 1. However, as Dalton then shifted his focus toward getting dressed, putting on his socks and tying his shoes in place on his feet, he spoke toward Sakura and asked, "So, um Sakura.....where am I exactly?"

"Oh! Um..... you're currently in the Grand Imperial Theater, home of the Imperial Opera Troupe–Flower Division. I, uh....I guess you sort of figured that out a little when you saw our Koubus." Sakura explained, giving the American some form of an answer. From there, as he began to put his white shirt on, tucking it underneath his olive-drab green formal military pants, Dalton looked back toward the young Japanese woman and said, "Koubu? ....I take it that's what you call those bulky suits of armor you and your friends were using?"

"Well, yes. We actually use them to fight the demons and those possessed machines that you destroyed last night. Though, Commander Yoneda called you a Titan when you appeared, and I've never heard of such a creature before.... At least, until very recently." Sakura replied, showcasing a but of her curiosity, just as Dalton rolled up his shirt sleeves halfway up his arms. However, he quickly stood up and turned to face Sakura when she mentioned her commanding officer/manager, as he spoke to her and asked, "Yoneda? As in Commander Ikki Yoneda? Ah Shit....I was assigned to be under his command when I was brought here!"

"Well, if you're eager to meet with Commander Yoneda..... I can help escort you to his office. After all, I have to head over there myself, anyway." Sakura answered, wanting to lend a hand to the person that saved her last night. Obviously due to his inexperience with the theater's overall layout, Dalton chose to accept Sakura's offer, as he walked up to the door, opened it, and replied, "Okay then, Sakura. Lead the way." Taking the lead, Sakura graciously walked out the opened door, shortly after she set the bouquet of flowers down on a nearby table. From there, Dalton soon followed closely behind her, easily catching up with her due to his size.

111211111222.content:
However, along the way toward Commander Yoneda's office, there was this awkward moment of silence between the two individuals. Of course, in an attempt to make things slightly less awkward, Sakura sparked up some form of a conversation, as she looked at Dalton and asked, "So, um...... Dalton, you're from America, right?" "Umm......yeah, I'm American. Why?" He replied, looking at her with his green eyes, somewhat confused as to why Sakura was asking him stuff like his nationality.

"I'm sorry if I am offending you or anything of the sort. Its just that.....last night, you saved the lives of both me and my friends, Dalton. And.....I want to get to know you a little better, if it isn't too much trouble." Sakura confessed, answering Dalton's question as to why she was somewhat curious about him. From there, he exhaled a deep breath, relieving the stress inside, as he the spoke to her and explained, "I came from Springfield, Illinois. Sure, it's not as famous as cities like New York City, San Francisco, or Los Angeles, but still....Springfield has been the home of my family for generations."

"So, where is Springfield located? You said that you're from America, so why would you say that you're from a place called Springfield, Illinois?" Sakura questioned, becoming slightly confused as to what Dalton was talking about. "Illinois is a part of America, Sakura. Where I come from, they're called States. Think of it as like a giant puzzle, with Illinois being one of those puzzle pieces. After all, New York City got it's name from the State its a part of, New York." He answered, simplifying his explanation towards someone like Sakura, whose never set foot on U.S soil before.

In response, Sakura grasped a better understanding of the United States thanks to Dalton, as she then spoke to the towering American and said, "I...I see. So, do you have any family members back in Springfield?" "Somewhat. There's my grandfather, Robert Todd Lincoln. My father and mother, Thomas and Martha Lincoln. My 2 brothers and 3 sisters. And a few of my Aunts and Uncles. The rest of my family are sort of spread out across the country. My family sort of takes pride from the accomplishments of my great-grandfather, Abraham Lincoln. He was the 16th President of the United States throughout the Civil War." Dalton explained, revealing his family's ties with President Lincoln.

Of course, Sakura was a little surprised at such a revelation from her savior, yet she has never heard of someone like Abraham Lincoln before until now, so she looked at him as they turned right into another hallway and asked, "I take it that your great-grandfather was someone very important in his time?" "So true, Sakura. Becoming President of the United States means you're becoming the leader of a country found on the ideals of freedom and equality, whether you're a man or a woman, or if you were born white or black. My great-grandfather passionately believed in such freedom and equality for every man, woman, and child. He was influential in giving people who were born into slavery a second lease on life. After all, we are born free, no matter what our gender is, or the color of our skin." Dalton replied, going into detail about his great-grandfather's motives and agenda as the President.

This made Sakura believe that Dalton's great-grandfather was an honorable a compassionate person, someone with a noble heart and noble intentions. From there, Sakura spoke toward the towering American beside her and replied, "It sounds like your great-grandfather was a kind and honorable man." "He was. Too bad not everyone agreed with him. Those who lived in the southern parts of the country weren't exactly agreeable with what Lincoln was doing when it came to giving the African slaves the same rights as everyone else. This was what caused the southern states to separate from the rest of the country, creating the Confederacy. Of course, the Confederates lost the civil war in 1865. Unfortunately, shortly after the war was over, my great-grandfather was murdered by a Confederate sympathizer named John Wilkes Booth. They buried my great-grandfather in Springfield, Illinois, the same city where he and my great-grandmother, Mary Todd Lincoln, first met and married." Dalton answered, going into detail as to the fate of his great-grandfather, which was a somber fate in and of itself.

Hearing such a sorrowful fate to a great man, Sakura's mood saddened slightly, as she spoke once more to Dalton and said, "I'm truly sorry about your great-grandfather, Dalton. I.... I wasn't aware that he was murdered." Seeing the look on her face, Dalton stopped her for a moment, as he faced Sakura, knelt down on his right knee to look directly at her, putting one hand on her left shoulder out of reassurance, where he spoke to her in a calm and caring tone and explained, "Sakura, I.....I understand that you feel depressed about my great-grandfather's death. However, you weren't the only one who mourned him. I'm proud of what he's accomplished when he was still alive, and his actions have inspired others to follow in his footsteps when it came to human rights. Our actions are capable of inspiring others to follow, to change the world for the better, Sakura. To be honest, I..... I never asked for this kind of power, but if I could use such a monstrous power to protect innocent lives.....I would not want my fate to be any other way."

In reaction to his soft-spoken words of wisdom, Sakura moved her head to make eye contact with Dalton's own green eyes, where she then displayed a caring and thankful smirk on her youthful face, as she spoke toward him and replied, "....Thank you, Dalton. Your words....truly mean a lot." "Anytime, Sakura.....anytime. Now then, what do you say we meet up with Commander Yoneda?" He complied, moving to the side to allow Sakura to continue leading him toward Yoneda's office.

Finally, after around 15 minutes of walking through the lavishly decorated hallways, Sakura and Dalton made their way to a set of mahogany wooden double doors, as Sakura spoke up and said, "Well, here we are: Commander Yoneda's Office. I'll inform him that you're awake." In response, Dalton nodded once in agreement, where Sakura then turned the doorknob on one of the doors, opening it to enter her commanding officer's workspace.

Basically, an intense amount of anger. Usually, I think of something that pisses me off in order to trigger my transformation into my Titan Form."

"Alright, so how long have you been like this, anyway?" Kanna asked, being the next person with a question, which prompted Dalton to answer rather quickly, as he looked at the Amazon-like redhead and explained, "...3 years. But over time, I learned how to hone my rage, use it as a weapon against anyone who wants to harm those who can't even defend themselves. Sometimes, in order to kill the monsters.....you have to become one yourself."

Although the other members of Flower Division each wanted their two cents into what exactly Dalton was capable of in his Titan Form, the next person to ask him for an answer was....

Upon seeing the wreckage from a distance, Dalton quickly realized what exactly it meant, as he then looked at Sakura and said, "That....That was where we first met and where I fought against Chimera."

Much like how you defeated that Chimera and protected us, me and the other members of Flower Division are dedicated to protecting the people of Tokyo, even to the point where we risk our lives to protect the innocent, those who would get caught in the crossfire. I know that you're still somewhat unsure about our motives, but I promise you: We're on the same side, we just simply don't have the same kind of power that you possess. Nothing more, nothing less."

Dalton couldn't help but admit to himself that Sakura made a very persuasive speech toward him, admiring her persistence. Eventually, after a considerable amount of time pondering about his final decision on the matter.....

I'll catch up with you!" Sakura could still tell that he was having a little difficulty making up his mind, so she spoke to the towering American and replied, "....Alright, but don't take too long."

And like that, Sakura hurried out of the park to rendezvous with her fellow comrades, leaving Dalton by himself at the park. After all, she could obviously see the struggle in him, as if it was like a reflection of herself when she was first assigned to the Flower Division. However, she shifted her focus to return to the Grand Imperial Theater to suit up in her Koubu. Fortunately, the Flower Division was given access to a fast-travel system via man-sized pods connected to a series of large underground pipeways which all converge upon the Grand Imperial Theater's underground headquarters, where Sakura used one of these pipelines near the park, entering inside and quickly traveling back to her comrades.

––––––––––––––––––––––

Shortly after returning to the Grand Imperial Theater, Sakura got herself undressed and put on her combat uniform, where she then proceeded to her Koubu, positioning herself inside as the cockpit hatch closed inward, licking her inside prepped for combat with the enemy. Of course, Commander Yoneda informed both her and the other Flower Division members that there was a platoon of demonic robots alongside the titanic creature, now confirmed as another Chimera. However they noticed that this Chimera had a much more varied appearance compared to the previous Chimera.

In appearance, this new Chimera had a much more bulkier physique, more akin to a gorilla. That is, if a gorilla had brownish-gray scales and had the head of a Komodo Dragon but with the teeth of a lion. It's hands looked like a set of bear paws, complete with stubby thick paw-like fingers and curved claws, as it walked on it's knuckles like a gorilla would in Africa. Finally, the Chimera's hind legs were like a bull's hind legs, complete with a set of hoof-like feet and thick muscular digitgrade legs, covered in brownish-gray scales with white tiger stripes on the thighs.

But as the group was launched and heading toward the battlefield, Sakura's thoughts turned to Dalton, worried about what he was going to do, as she thought to herself and said, "Dalton.....I hope you are able to understand. Please, do what you think is right."

–––––––––––––––––––––––

Meanwhile back at the park, Dalton continued to struggle on his decision. Sure, he was already aware of the threat that has now showed it's ugly beastly mug once more, but......Was it really "His" fight to begin with? His thoughts went back and forth on the subject, currently at a stalemate, as he looked at both of his hands and thought, "....What should I do? *Sigh* if only my sister was here, she would've told me off and tell me to go save lives. And yet, Sakura......she felt like my sister reincarnated."

Suddenly, his thoughts were abruptly interrupted by a loud and deep inhuman howl, "KKUWAAAAAAAAAAAAGHHAAAAAAAAA!!!!!!!!!!!" From there, Dalton quickly stood up and saw what exactly made such a noise, revealing to be another giant creature like the Chimera from last night. "That creature.....could it be another Chimera?" He asked himself, just as he noticed a group of fast moving objects rushing toward the massive beast from a distance.

"That must be Sakura and her friends, but.....they don't stand a chance against that monster!" He thought to himself once more, remembering the events from last night, knowing that they're able to fight against those possessed machines, but their chances of defeating such a massive creature were very slim to none, which heaved more on his moral conscience, as he began to pace around slightly.

But then, a dreadful thought came to him as he said, "But if I don't help them, they.....they're gonna die. And it'll be all my fault, just like what happened to Emily!" The thought of his sister's tragic demise haunted him, and the same thing that could potentially happen to Sakura and her comrades weighed more on his moral compass. But then, a burning spark erupted inside him as he growled, "NO!! ....I will not lose anyone else. EVER. AGAIN!" He knew that feeling all too well: it was the Titan side of him, clawing it's way up, causing his eyes to quickly change from green to a burnt orange hue. His breathing became more aggressive, his fingers tightly clenched into a set of fists! He now knew what he had to do: he had to become a Titan once more and protect Sakura from the monster!

"In order to kill a monster, I must become one myself!" Dalton hissed under his own breath, remembering those words he said to the members of Flower Division earlier, as he then sprinted toward the cliffside at full speed, where he then leapt off the cliff and began plummeting toward the ground below! His anger building up, his rage boiling over until......THOOOOM!!!!! A large pillar of flaming light erupted from where Dalton stood, his human body encasing itself in bone, muscle, and skin, forming a massive physical form! And once he landed hard upon the ground, he had completely transformed into his Titan Form once again, steam rising from his newly-created form, unleashing a powerful guttural howl to let his presence be known across the area for miles, screaming into the air and roared, "GGRRAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAH!!!!!!!!!!!"

With a limited window of time, Dalton hurried toward where Sakura and the others were fighting the new Chimera, swiftly transitioning into a full-on sprint, clocking in at 75 miles per hour in 2 seconds flat. About 5 blocks down, Dalton quickly turned a sharp right, his Titan body responding to his thoughts on where to go, his inhuman speed staying consistent the whole way through.

Along the way, a large group of people evacuating the Ginza District were directly in his path, forcing him to leap over them just as they attempted to quickly move onto the sidewalks, where they felt the violent gust of wind rushing past them as Dalton quickly passed by them, knock a dozen or two civilians off their footing. However from a distance, Dalton could see that the bulky Chimera had performed a powerful sonic attack as it screamed, "KKUWAAAAAAAAAAAAGHHAAAAAAAAAAAAA!!!!!!!!!!!" Seeing what the titanic creature had performed as it destroyed several buildings in the process, Dalton knew he had to kill it quickly, his thoughts racing involving Sakura and her friends. "Come on, Sakura! Please don't die on me!" He thought, becoming increasingly concerned for her well-being, moving faster as he rapidly turned left on another intersection, directly leading into the Ginza District.

Upon seeing the Chimera about to swipe it's large left arm toward Sakura, Kanna, and Reni, Dalton got even angrier, sprinting at 90 miles per hour until......KKRRAAANK!!!! Dalton rammed his Titan Form directly into the Chimera's side, sending the beast back by 6 blocks, as Dalton bellowed a guttural and hostile howl toward the grotesque monstrosity as he roared, "GGRRAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAH!!!!!!!!!!!!" "Dalton!" Sakura exclaimed, looking up at him in his transformed state, as Reni proceeded to help her comrade up onto her feet with her Koubu and said, "Come on, Sakura. We should help the others."

Sakura nodded in agreement, just as she noticed the Chimera getting back up while Dalton moved his body into a fighting stance, hands clenched into fists and ready to deliver a beatdown. In a fit of rage, the Chimera retaliated by rushing at the Titan, running toward him on all fours like an ape, hoping to deliver the same attack, but Dalton quickly strafed to his left, avoiding the Chimera's arm swipe. From there, Dalton swiftly grabbed something fleshy underneath the Chimera's upper back, tearing out a large organ while the beast struggled and howled in frustration, which it used for it's sonic screams, as he tossed it aside like garbage! "Hell yeah! Come on, Dalton! KICK IT'S ASS!!" Kanna yelled, obviously having a thrilled excitement along with cheering on the Titan.

Now enraged, the Chimera quickly turned around, and wrapped it's thick arms around Dalton in a violent bear hug! Dalton responded by delivering several strong punches in hopes of freeing himself, but to no avail, as the Chimera tossed him 20 blocks away, landing him right in the middle of Tokyo's wharves! "DALTON!!" Sakura screamed, showcasing her concern for Dalton. However, before she could even head over to check on him, Kanna and Reni prevented her from doing so. "Snap out of it, Sakura!" Kanna exclaimed, trying to reason with her.

"You've seen what this Chimera is capable of. If you go out there and help Dalton, there's a chance you can die!" Reni flatly explained, convincing Sakura that going up against the Chimera now was considered suicide. Left with no choice on the matter, Sakura ended her struggle and returned to fighting the demonic robots, as she could hear the Chimera's thunderous footsteps heading toward where Dalton was now currently located. "Dalton.....please be alright." She thought to herself, praying that he was alright and still able to continue fighting.

But the bad news is that the Chimera was now focused on him, since he did outright attacked the colossal beast.

"KKUUWAAAAAAAAAAAA!!!!!!" The Chimera screeched, bellowing a threatening and angered roar toward the Titan, but Dalton wasn't phased by such a mere threat. He thought, his mental voice meshed with his Titan's howls and roars, intent on protecting Sakura and the rest of the Flower Division from this monstrous abomination, emitting a threatening growl at the Chimera in response.

And with a wet thunderous bone-cracking sound as the dropkick connected with the Chimera's head, the colossal monstrosity became staggered upon impact, just as Dalton fell onto the ground! Despite his tremendous size, he quickly sprung back onto his feet, where he then grabbed the Chimera by it's reptilian head and began to pummel it with several powerful punches! The Chimera attempted to counter it's opponent, but to no avail with each titanic punch it absorbed, as Dalton ended the barrage of fist attacks with a thunderous but powerful haymaker, knocking the Chimera into the side of a nearby warehouse, smashing through the building's wall and rooftop!

In retaliation, the Chimera then grabbed a nearby crane, tearing the machine from it's foundations, wielding it like a giant makeshift club! "KUWAAAAAGHAAAAAA!!!!!!" It howled, swinging the makeshift weapon at Dalton, forcing the Titan to dodge a few of the swings until he swiftly grabbed it's arm, whacked the titanic beast with a meaty backhand to stun it, then twisted the Chimera's arm toward it's back, and delivered a powerful kick from behind the gigantic creature, launching it into a set of much larger steel cranes!

For a moment, Dalton looked toward where Sakura and the others were fighting the demonic machines, as Sakura sliced through several of the machines with each sword swing from her Koubu-sized katana. Shortly after slicing through her 5th demonic robot, she turned and saw that Dalton was very much intact, feeling relieved to see he was alright. "Thank god, he's....he's alright." She said to herself, letting out a sigh of relief.

But then, she suddenly saw that the Chimera was starting to get back up, as it violently rushed toward Dalton from behind! Quickly, Sakura screamed as loud as she possibly could and yelled, "DALTON, LOOK OUT!!!" Fortunately, Dalton heard Sakura's warning, as he quickly realized what was happening, where he dove down and rapidly delivered a swift kick toward the Chimera's right hooved leg, cracking it's bones some in the process!

In turn, this caused the Chimera's leg to buckle, as it toppled into another warehouse on it's side while it roared in rage and pain, "KKUWAAAAAAAAAAAAGHHAAAAAAAAAAAAA!!!!!!!" From there, Dalton proceeded to stand back up, as he then grabbed the heavyweight Chimera and tossed the titanic abomination over his head with all of his might, launching the Chimera into several rows of railroad cars, smashing the train boxcars, hoppers, and tank cars into smithereens upon impact! From there, Dalton grabbed a large piece of the steel crane, bending it into a makeshift club/spear, as he then rushed the Chimera while it was recovering from being thrown by it's adversary! And with a metal-grinding SKKRRUUNNK!!, Dalton swung his massive makeshift weapon like a giant metal baseball bat with tremendous power and force, causing the Chimera's lower jaw to crack and fracture upon impact with the metal beam, sending the colossal hybrid back on the floor stunned!

This left the ape-like beast open and vulnerable to attack, just as the Titan deliver several more downward swings against the Chimera before he proceeded to impale the bulky Chimera, as the large steel beam was thrusted through it's reptilian head, delivering that fatal blow against the Chimera! With his enemy dead, Dalton bellowed a victorious roar, howling into the sky as he roared, "GGRRAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAH!!!!!!! GGRRAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAH!!!!!!!!" Of course, while they were clashing against their mechanical enemies, Sakura and her friends heard Dalton's roars of victory loud and clear, letting them know that the Chimera was now officially dead.

111211111222211212113.content:
Some time after the titanic battle that had occurred within the Ginza District, Commander Yoneda and his second-in-command, Vice Commander Ayame Fujieda, had assembled before a group of respective gentlemen, known only as the Council of Elders. Each member has supported the Flower Division by pooling in the necessary funds to develop the Koubu units they use in battle, manufactured by Kanzaki Heavy Industries. In layman's terms, they were a council of very wealthy individuals, each member having a single similar motive: To protect their beloved Imperial Capital of Tokyo from the relentless dark forces.

However, one member stood out among the rest of his fellow Council members. In appearance, he was a physically fit individual currently in his twilight years, judging from his receding ivory white hair, with white sideburns and ivory white eyebrows, along with sporting several wrinkles on parts of his face. He wore the attire of a businessman, one whose experience has made him the distinct voice of reason to his fellow Council members. His name....was Count Yoritsune Hanakõji, and he had become the benevolent but fair head of the Council of Elders.

Currently, he and the rest of Council fazed upon the recorded stock footage of Dalton in his Titan Form, fighting against the Chimera that appeared today, with the elderly Yoritsune paying keen attention to the briefing by Ayame Fujieda, as she spoke toward the Council Elders and explained, "As you can see, gentlemen: the Titan was able to confront the Chimera within the Ginza District and was able to destroy it, despite the amount of collateral damage sustained during the battle." ".....Hmph! That's putting it mildly, Vice Commander Fujieda, considering how much property damage the wharf has undergone during the battle." One council member remarked, obviously somewhat discontent with the overall cost of the damage caused during the fight between the Titan and the Chimera.

"I agree. These creatures have caused nearly 2 million yen in property damage alone, not just structural damage but also in demolishing several hundred thousand yen in damaged cargo goods." Another council member replied, agreeing with his colleague on such a trivial economic matter. However, Count Hanakõji spoke up his thoughts on the discussion at hand, simmering the tension brewing in the air a little, speaking to his fellow Council members with a calm but wise tone and answered, "Gentlemen! I understand your concerns for the damage ensued during the battle between these two colossal entities. However, this is hardly the forum for an economic crises, for these....."Chimera" creatures are a more dangerous threat than the mechanical monstrosities the Flower Division has been combating. Commander Yoneda, what can you tell us about this "Titan" creature that has fought against this Chimera?"

Upon being asked by Count Hanakõji regarding the Titan, Commander Yoneda cleared his throat some before speaking, as he faced the Count and the rest of the Council of Elders and explained, "To be more precise, gentlemen: the footage presented to you all just now was not the Titan's first appearance. Nearly 24 hours ago, he appeared to fight against another Chimera Fujieda and I have appropriately given the codename "Wendigo", due to it's malnourished yet powerful physique. The Chimera you've seen on film was given the codename "Berserker", because of it's aggressive and violent behavior. Now as for the Titan itself, gentlemen.....this should clear things up some."

From there, Commander Yoneda handed out a detailed military file and dossier on Dalton Lincoln, showing the Council of Elders the Titan's true identity. "Lieutenant Captain Dalton Coulson Lincoln. So.....I assume this happens to be the Titan's identity, Commander Yoneda?" "That is correct, Count Hanakõji. To elaborate, Dalton can transform himself into the Titan you all have witnessed from the stock footage we've presented. Now as for it's exact measurements, we've estimated that Dalton's Titan Form to accurately be 15 meters in height from head to toe, which makes him taller than a 4 story building." Yoneda answered, giving some clarification to the other council members regarding Dalton's ability to transform into a Titan.

"This is ridiculous! How can one man transform into such a creature? It seems impossible." Another council member said, obviously skeptical involving the information revealed to them. In response, Yoneda calmly fired back and replied, "I understand the skepticism, gentlemen. However, according to the information that Lieutenant Captain Lincoln has revealed to both me, Fujieda, and the Flower Division, he had this ability to transform into a Titan for 3 straight years, which meant that he was merely 17 years of age when he acquired such power. Now as for the trigger to this transformation, Dalton explained that it is caused by an intense amount of anger, allowing him to transform into the state that was shown on the film. And from what I've seen so far, it appears that Dalton is keen on protecting one of the Flower Division's members, Ms. Sakura Shinguji, judging from his behavior of course."

"You make it sound like Ms. Shinguji is the beauty, and Dalton as the beast." Count Hanakõji said, obviously seeing the connection from what Commander Yoneda had explained previously. In response, Yoneda let out a light chuckle and replied, "Maybe.... But it's obvious that Dalton happens to be very protective of Sakura and her comrades, since he has saved them more than once against the Chimera during the past 24 hours. However, despite the collateral damage, I believe that having Dalton as a member of the Flower Division will be a wise choice, since it seems the Koubu units might not withstand the raw power of these Chimera. After all, Lieutenant Captain Lincoln said so himself: "In order to kill monsters, we must have one of our own". Therefore, I believe that having Dalton as a member of the Flower Division is the right decision."

However, just as a few of the Council members were about to argue over Commander Yoneda's decision to allow Dalton to be a member of Flower Division, Count Hanakõji made a physical gesture to cease their rabble, as he then spoke toward Commander Yoneda and answered, "....Very well, Commander. We'll allow Lieutenant Captain Lincoln to join the Flower Division. Keep us informed regarding such a......unique individual." With that, Commander Yoneda and Vice Commander Fujieda took their leave, returning to the Imperial Grand Theater. Of course, this struck a nerve for one or two of the Council members once the two individuals left the room.

1112111112222112121131.content:
Meanwhile back at the Grand Imperial Theater, Sakura and the other members of the Flower Division had returned from their battle against the possessed robots and the Chimera known as "Berserker" merely hours ago, with Dalton in tow. Of course, Dalton helped in destroying the remaining steam robots after killing Berserker, using his Titan Form to smash groups of the demonic machines to kingdom come.

Currently, as he was roaming through the hallway corridors of the theater, Dalton approached the door to Sakura's bedroom, knocked on the door with the back of his hand once or twice, and asked, "Sakura, it's me. Mind if I come in for a minute?" "Not at all! Just give me a second." Sakura quickly replied, since she was currently getting dressed for bed. A moment later, Dalton heard and noticed the door opening, as he then walked inside her room.

"How are you holding up, Sakura?" He asked, wanting to know if Sakura wasn't injured during the battle against the Chimera from earlier, where Sakura turned around to face him and answered, "I'm alright, Dalton. Thank you." "For what?" Dalton said, raising an eyebrow out of slight confusion, as Sakura walked over to her bed and sat down on the bed's mattress, then looked at Dalton and replied, "...For saving me and my friends twice already. Both from last night and today as well."

From hearing such a thankful response, Dalton couldn't help but blush some, scratching the back of his head a little and answered, "I, uhh.....Y-You're welcome, Sakura." From there, Sakura gestured Dalton to have a seat next to her, which he accepted, as he sat down beside the young Japanese woman. However, despite the bed creaking a little due to Dalton's overall size and height, it managed to hold up pretty well.

Shortly after an awkward moment of silence between the two individuals, Dalton spoke up toward Sakura and said, "So, um....I'm guessing you're wondering what my reasons were for coming to save you, huh?" "Well, that thought never crossed my mind, Dalton." Sakura answered, replying with honesty in her tone of voice, believing that Dalton rescued Sakura and her comrades out of the goodness in his heart. Although that was true to an extent, Dalton knew that there was more to his actions from the past 24 hours than just a crisis of conscience.

Knowing that it was better to confess now rather than later, Dalton spoke his mind and answered, "The truth is, Sakura.....I had my reasons for coming to rescue you and your friends. And it's more than just one single form of motivation. You see, I.....I once had a sister back in Illinois. Her...Her name was Emily Attano Lincoln. You would both get along great if she were here." In honesty, Sakura was a little surprised at the realization that he had a sister, so she looked at him and replied, "Really? I didn't know you actually had a sister, Dalton."

However, Sakura then noticed this slightly depressed look on Dalton's face, realizing that something bad might've happened to his sister Emily, where she then spoke toward him and asked, "Something.....bad happened to your sister....didn't it?" In response, Dalton slowly nodded in confirmation, then spoke to Sakura and confessed, "Emily....was attacked by a local gang of thugs, they wanted to rape her, but......one of them accidentally stabbed her in the stomach. With a knife. She....she died of internal bleeding within a few hours. The trauma of....of her death was the catalyst for my powers: The power to transform into a Titan."

Upon hearing the tragic fate of Dalton's sister, Sakura was reminded of her father and his passing, fully understanding how Dalton felt about losing a loved one, as she spoke to him and said, "....I understand your pain, Dalton. My father....he died of illness when I was only 16 years old." From hearing of Sakura's own loss, Dalton felt somewhat reassured, as he looked at her and replied, "....Thank you, Sakura. That means a lot." From there, he continued speaking and said, ".....Ever since the death of my sister Emily, I began to develop something the Shrinks call "Thantophobia". The fear of losing someone I deeply care about, even love. You remind me very much of Emily, Sakura. You're kind, gentle, and polite, always having a bright and cheerful personality coupled with a strong sense of justice. She....she was studying to becoming a Judge for the Supreme Court before the events that transpired that night. If she were still alive, she would've been the same age as you, Sakura. And I'm sure the two of you would have become the best of friends."

Finding a way to cheer up the mood some, Sakura spoke toward Dalton once more and answered, "When I was just a young girl, if I was hurt, my father once told me "Sakura: scars only remind us of who we are, they don't dictate where we're going in life". At first, I didn't understand what he meant, but I later understood what he was saying as I got older." "Your father sounds like an honorable and kind man." Dalton said, understanding what Sakura was telling him, along with feeling reassured from those words of wisdom. "I....I know I've already said these words, but....Thank you. For opening up to me." Sakura replied, just as she then performed something very unexpected: She planted a tender kiss on Dalton's right cheek, causing him to blush a deep crimson hue, smirking a bashful smirk on his face.

"I, er....I... I s-should be getting to bed. It's....It's been a long day." Dalton bashfully answered, causing Sakura giggle a tiny bit from Dalton's blushing, nodding in agreement with the day already transitioning into a moonlit night. From there, she spoke toward Dalton and replied, "Agreed, it is getting rather late. Well, good night, Dalton." "Same to you, Sakura." He said, as he then stood up from Sakura's bed and walked out the door, still branding a crimson blush on his face, like a boy having a crush on a girl of his dreams. However, shortly after he closed the door as he left, Sakura couldn't help but blush a little herself, beginning to develop some potential romantic feelings toward Dalton, while she laid on her bed and covered herself in the bedsheets, along with turning off the lamp light in the process. From there, only her dreams await, as she closed her eyes and dozed off, waiting for a new tomorrow.

Overall, despite the rumors buzzing around involving the Titan, Tokyo slowly but progressively returned to normal, as the property damage ensued from the Titan's previous appearances were fully restored to their original conditions before those two battles.

Letting his curiosity get the better of him, Dalton cautiously proceeded to enter backstage, wanting to catch a glimpse of what the commotion was about, being as discreet as he possibly could.

Moments after stepping inside backstage, Dalton took a peek and saw Sakura, Iris, and several other members of the Flower Division reading what appear to be scripts to a play in each of their hands. "Oh yeah, that's right: they're rehearsing for a play. Wonder what kind of play they're going to perform?" Dalton curiously thought, theorizing on which play they intend on performing. However, he then heard a familiar voice as it said, "You're rather curious, aren't you?"

In response, Dalton turned himself around to face whoever was speaking to him, only to reveal that it was none other than Commander Yoneda, who also happened to be the manager of the Flower Division by their stage name, the Imperial Opera Troupe. "Oh! Commander Yoneda, I didn't see you there for a moment." "It's quite alright, Dalton. And please, call me Yoneda. After all, you can't call me Commander Yoneda when we're incognito." Yoneda replied, reminding the Lieutenant Captain not to call him by his military rank, since the Imperial Opera Troupe is an alias for the Flower Division.

"Good point. So....which play are Sakura and the others doing anyway?" Dalton asked, keeping the volume of his voice down to avoid disturbing Sakura and the others while they were rehearsing. Of course, Yoneda willingly answered Dalton's question and explained, "Sakura and the others are rehearsing a play from Western literature. More specifically, a fairy tale. I believed it's called "Beauty & The Beast". I'm sure you remember such a tale."

Obviously, Dalton was very familiar with the tale of Beauty and the Beast. It was considered as one of his favorite childhood stories, which seemed all the more ironic given his ability to transform into a Titan. Of course, in response to what Yoneda had said to him, Dalton looked back at his commanding officer and answered, "Yeah, very much so, sir. However, I sometimes find that it reminds me of the twisted irony considering my....monstrous abilities. So, which role will Sakura be playing?"

To sate his curiosity, Yoneda spoke once more toward Dalton and replied, "Originally, Sumire wanted to play the role of Belle. However, I've decided to mix it up some and have offered the role to Sakura. After all, an actress must be versatile in the role she's been given, and I could see some of that same potential in Sakura. She's fresh sure, but with enough practice, I think she can be one of the best actresses in the Imperial Capital." Dalton couldn't help but display a mischievous smirk on his face, chuckling a bit on imagining Sumire's reaction to such a major decision in theatrical casting, as he then spoke toward Yoneda and said, "*chuckle* Yeah, I guess Sumire would definitely be pissed off from that."

"Alright, so if Sakura is playing as Belle....then who's going to play the role of the Beast?" Dalton asked, obviously curious about who the role of the Beast should go to. After all, he was thinking that either Kanna or Maria would suit the role due to their masculinity. However, it was there that Yoneda spoke toward Dalton once more and answered....

111211111222211212113121.content:
"Well, I have a good idea about who will be playing as the Beast. He's rather recent to the troupe, but I'm content that he'll perform with grace." Yoneda answered, giving off a subtle hint or two about who will be the Beast toward Dalton. Of course, Dalton thought it was somebody else instead of him, as he spoke toward Yoneda and said, "I hope so, seeing as how committed Sakura and the others are with this play."

A moment or two later, Yoneda then replied, "Actually.....I was thinking of you, Dalton." "Yeah....Wait, what?!" Dalton answered, just as he quickly realized what Yoneda meant by someone new to the troupe, which of course, was him. He had this look of shock on his face in reaction to such a revelation. Shortly after letting this information settle in, Dalton spoke once more toward his commanding officer and asked, "Okay, so why me? Couldn't you choose someone else like Maria or Sumire? I mean, they've got more experience in performing on stage than I do."

"To elaborate, Dalton: The two main roles of Beauty and the Beast must have a developing relationship between the actor and the actress. After all, Belle develops a relationship with the Beast over the course of the story. And besides, I am fully aware of the budding relationship between you and Ms. Sakura Shinguji, Dalton. Thus, it would be more believable for the audience as a whole." Yoneda thoroughly explained, fully aware of the blooming romance between Dalton and Sakura. To be honest, Dalton was aware that his relationship with Sakura would've been exposed eventually, he just didn't know how soon such a revelation would be revealed, as he looked at Yoneda and asked, "....So, how long have you known about this?"

".....I've been aware of this for 4 days now, Dalton. And despite Sumire's protests, I still believe you to be fit for the role of the Beast. Now then, what do you say?" Yoneda answered, asking if Dalton would accept the role of the Beast onstage. However, it was sort of a conflicting deal. On one end, he would be spending a bit more time with Sakura, along with conveying his feelings toward the young Japanese woman in the guise of a fictional character. But on the other hand, Dalton was worried that he might possibly screw up badly onstage in front of a massive audience. Overall, it was a taxing decision to overcome.
111211111222211212113121.title: A Newcomer To The Troupe

choices: Eventually, Dalton made his way to the gym, where Kanna awaits.
Actually, he ran into someone else along the way there......

1112111112222112121131211.content:
Although he was somewhat inexperienced when it came to performing the theatrical arts, Dalton certainly knew his way around a role he was given. However, he was given either a supporting role or a minor character role in a theatrical performance..... That is, until Yoneda offered him the role of one of the two main protagonists of Beauty and the Beast on a metaphorical silver platter. Overall, how could he refuse? Eventually, after giving a moment of thought, Dalton decided to wing it and answered, "......Eh, why the hell not."

As he shook hands with his commanding officer in accepting the role, Dalton heard Yoneda speak toward him and replied, "I figured you wouldn't refuse, Lieutenant-Captain." "So, when do I start rehearsing anyway?" Dalton asked, wanting to know when he'll get started, as he severed the handshake. Of course, Yoneda proceeded to respond as he answered, "...I'll have to inform Sakura and the others first before you can begin rehearsal. But in the meantime, Kanna informed me to tell you she wants another sparring match."

"Figured as much. *sigh* Guess it's time for Kanna's School of Hard Knocks." Dalton sarcastically remarked, seeing as how he still remembered the difficult sparring with Kanna Kirishima some time ago. After all, his fighting methods were more akin to that of a professional boxer, which is rendered relatively futile against the versatility of a trained martial artist. However, knowing Kanna and some of her fighting techniques by now, she would use a mix between quick lightning-fast jabs and roundhouse kicks, alternating between these two attack patterns.

"Yeah, she's definitely going to kick my ass....again." Dalton thought to himself, as he traversed his way through the halls of the Imperial Grand Theater, progressively making his way toward the gymnasium, where Kanna was already there and awaiting for Dalton's arrival.
1112111112222112121131211.title: Just Winging It

choices: Dalton, who has finally triumphed over Kanna for the first time.
Kanna, whose experience has won this bout once more.
Actually, the fight ended in a draw....
11121111122221121211312111.content:
After treading through the long hallways of the Imperial Grand Theater, Dalton eventually arrived at the entrance to the gymnasium, noticing one of the two doors was already open,which meant that Kanna was already inside. After all, he can hear the Amazonian woman's light grunts with each punch, jab, and kick she delivered into the air, as if she was fighting an invisible foe.

With no point in delaying the inevitable, Dalton slowly entered the gymnasium, stepping on the hardwood flooring upon entering the spacious room, where he spoke up and said, "You wanted to see me, Kanna?" In response, Kanna quickly became aware of his presence, where she halted her martial exercising, as she then looked at him with a tomboyish smirk and answered, "Well, you certainly took your sweet time, Dalton."

"What can I say? You didn't exactly take things easy on me, Kanna." Dalton replied, where he followed the red-haired brawler toward a section of the gymnasium covered with lightly padded mats, which were obviously made for sparring matches like this. Once the two individuals stepped foot upon the mats, Kanna positioned her body into a fighting stance, hands curled into fists, as she spoke toward him and said, "So, ready for a rematch?" Of course, Dalton responded to such a question by cracking the knuckles on his hands, then positioned himself in a boxer's fighting stance, hands and fingers clenched into fists, looking at the red-haired Amazon of a woman with a determined and serious look on his face as he replied, "....Bring it."

From there, the fight between Kanna and Dalton had begun with determined ferocity. Kanna began her assault by delivering several quick jabs toward Dalton, but he was able to block the attack with some effort. However, from past experience with her, Dalton was able to predict what Kanna was going to do next, as she performed a powerful and swift sweeping kick, which was designed to knock an opponent off their feet, both metaphorically and quite literally. Fortunately, Dalton quickly leapt backwards to avoid Kanna's sweeping kick, which was a very close call due to Kanna's overall size and physique. After all, the red-haired woman was nearly 7 feet in height, giving the Amazon of a woman a good amount of attack range, so Dalton had to be very cautious when attacking someone such as Kanna, who could easily overpower him if he lets his guard down for a second or two.

Shortly after dodging her attack, Dalton quickly rushed at Kanna, deliver one or two successful punches, then quickly backed away from Kanna to avoid a counterattack by her hand. However, the reason for these sparring matches was to hone Dalton's combat skills, which in turn, would make him a more versatile fighter when he transforms into his Titan Form. Overall, this would benefit him the next time a Chimera appears.

From there, Kanna then performed several roundhouse kicks aimed for Dalton's upper body and head, as he evaded the first and second roundhouse kick, then blocked the third roundhouse kick with his left arm, gritting his teeth from the sheer force behind Kanna's kick, struggling with all of his might to halt the momentum in the red-haired Amazon's attack. Then, in a quick decisive move, Dalton swiftly wrapped both his arms around Kanna's leg, and with all of his strength, he swung Kanna to his left, then let's go of her leg, causing her to be tossed 7 feet away from him.

Thanks to her martial prowess, Kanna quickly recovered onto her feet, where the two individuals began to slowly circle one another, anticipating each other's moves. "Nice move. Where did ya learn that?" Kanna said, a little impressed by Dalton's grapple technique. In response, Dalton spoke toward his opponent and remarked, "My uncle. He was a professional wrestler back when he was my age." Shortly after the small conversation, the battle between these two combatants reignited once more, exchanging blow after blow, neither side faltering in this endeavor. Eventually, one of these two warriors would prevail over the other, which came in the form of.....
11121111122221121211312111.title: Kanna's School of Hard Knocks

choices: From there, Li wanted to see Dalton for something important.
Sakura came in to visit Dalton for something.....
Actually, something else happened instead..
111211111222211212113121111.content:
Although he already had prior experience when sparring against Kanna, Dalton knew what sort of attack the red-haired Amazon was about to perform next, a technique that always left him defeated in the end: The Hydra Heel-Kick. It was one of Kanna's more devastating attacks, which would start off as an arm grab, then a disarming flip of the opponent, and finishes off with a powerful downward heel kick to the opponent's abdomen, knocking them out of the fight.

And yet, despite her Amazonian physique, Kanna was capable of performing such an attack with great dexterity and swift agility. "Not this time!" Dalton thought to himself, as he quickly strafed to Kanna's left, flanking her in the process. After all, he wasn't going to fall for Kanna's Hydra Heel-Kick once more. From there, he quickly wrapped his arms underneath Kanna's armpits and interlocking his fingers behind Kanna's neck, completing one of his uncle's professional wrestling moves: The Russian Headlock.

And with all of his strength, Dalton contorted his body, yanking Kanna off her feet, causing her to land hard on the floor stomach first, with Dalton on top of her, still restraining her in a Russian Headlock with no sign of loosening his grip on her. After struggling for a minute or two, Kanna simply displayed an impressed smirk on her face and said, "Not bad, Dalton. Not bad at all."

Now realizing that he had won against Kanna for the very first time, Dalton released his grip on Kanna, returning the articulated movement of her arms once more, as he stood up and backed away from Kanna while she stood back up onto her feet, obviously to congratulate Dalton on winning against her.
111211111222211212113121111.title: The First of Several Victories

An enhanced sonar device for detecting Chimera.

1112111112222112121131211111.content:
"And by the way, Li wanted me to tell you that she wants to see you after you're done here." Kanna said, informing him to go pay Li a visit ASAP. Of course, he nodded in agreement as he slowly walked away and answered, "Thanks. I'll keep that in mind." From there, Dalton left the gymnasium through the double doors, as he proceeded toward the laboratories. After all, he can only expect to find there due to past experience, along with being fully aware of her inventions either being accident-prone or the possibility of blowing up in the girl's face.

––––––––––––––––––––––

After treading through the theater's interior, Dalton finally made his way inside the laboratories, where the Flower Division's Koubus were stationed until they were needed for combat with the enemy. Of course, he kept a good distance from Li due to her accident-prone reputation involving her inventions. "*Sigh* Here's hoping Li's newest invention doesn't blow my face off." He thought to himself, as he made his down the long flight of stairs, only to hear another small explosion and a large cloud of black smoke appeared in the process.

"Jesus H! What the hell is Li up to now?!" Dalton thought to himself once more, noticing the cloud of black smoke, as he rushed over there a little to see if Li was alright. Fortunately, as the black smoke was clearing up, there sat Li, covered in soot on both her youthful face and her green jumpsuit, coughing some due to another invention of hers blowing up in her face once more as she said, "*Cough* *Cough*...Aww, not again! This is the second time this week!"

"You wanted to see me, Li?" Dalton asked, interrupting Li's train of thought along with grasping her attention, where she then quickly stood up onto her feet to face him and answered, "Oh, Dalton! I, uh....I wasn't expecting to see you quite so soon." "Yeah, well..... You weren't exactly subtle when it comes to your inventions, especially if they coincidentally blow up in your face." Dalton remarked, sarcastically criticizing Li a little for her supposed inventions always exploding in her face for some strange reason..

Shifting the subject instead, Dalton then looked at Li and asked, "Anyway, I heard from Kanna that you wanted to see me about something. So, what is it?" "Oh, yes! Well, let me first get it out for you." Li replied, as she walked into another room, where Dalton then heard the sounds of clanging metal, as if Li was looking for something in particular. However, after several minutes have passed, Li finally emerged with something in her hands, which she revealed to be.....
1112111112222112121131211111.title: Testing A Prototype

11121111122221121211312111111.content:
"Uh, Li......What the hell is that?" Dalton asked, somewhat confused over what she revealed to him. In appearance, the device looked like a rucksack with straps attached to it, useful as a makeshift backpack. However, there were a set of wires coming out of the rucksack and attached to a set of headphones with a microphone piece, used for communicating with a squad of soldiers. In response, Li spoke to Dalton and explained, "Oh this? This is a specialized communication device I've designed just for you. More specifically, when you change into your Titan Form, Dalton."

Realizing that the "communication device" Li built was reserved for him, Dalton had this concerned look on his face, scratching the back of his head some in the process and answered, "*sigh* Why do I get the feeling that you haven't tested this thing yet?" Obviously seeing his remark as some form of doubtful insult, Li then fired back and replied, "Nonsense! I've been testing this device for a good chunk of my time now." Of course, he then turned his head to the right, becoming fully aware of the mannequins each blackened by soot from a small man-sized explosion.

"Oh great. Li's newest invention is combustible. Just exactly what I need when I turn into a Titan." He thought to himself, with signs of sarcasm in his tone. Then again, this was something that Li had extensively worked on for a good amount of time, which forced Dalton to go along with the young mechanic's plan and said, "Fine, I'll do it. This thing better not blow me to smithereens, Li."

"It won't! Trust me, I made sure that the batteries didn't overheat and spontaneously combust. You just make sure it's working at 110 percent." Li answered, as she approached Dalton and strapped the communication device onto him, correcting the straps' measurements over his arms, checking if it fits him comfortably. From there, Li inserted the headphones onto his head, the speakers planting themselves against his ears.

Out of concern, Dalton then spoke up toward Li and said, "No offense, Li, but you do realize that I need my ears exposed in order to hear while in my Titan Form, right?" Upon realizing such a revelation, Li literally dropped what she was doing, turning around to face Dalton and yelped, "What do ya mean you need to hear?" "Well....it's more of a sensory connection, Li. While I'm in my Titan Form, each of the muscles and nerves in my Titan body are connected to my human body as a whole, and that includes almost all of my senses. Hearing, Sight, Smell, Touch, you know, THOSE kinds of senses." Dalton explained, giving the young inventor a thorough explanation on how he functions while he's in his Titan Form, which began to stack up on the negative aspects of making him wear a prototype wireless communication device, which include hindering his hearing while he's changed into a Titan.
11121111122221121211312111111.title: Wireless Communication

111211111222211212113121111111.content:
However, just as Li snatched away the prototype communication device to tinker around with it so she could improve it's design, Dalton heard some footsteps coming downstairs, which then revealed to be none other than Sakura Shinguji herself, who was apparently looking for him. "Ha, there you are! I've been looking for you." Sakura said, where she then approached the American, almost with a spring in her step, as if she was eagerly anticipating something.

"Well, you found me. So, what's with the giddy look on your face?" Dalton asked, causing Sakura to blush some in slight embarrassment. Of course, shortly after regaining her composure, she then spoke toward him and said, "...Well, um...today is the beginning of the Cherry Blossom Festival, and I was wondering if you could...if you could, um..." "-Join you in this festival? Of course, Sakura! I don't mind." Dalton replied, willingly accepting the girl's invitation in the process.

In turn, this left with Sakura feeling quite excited, which prompted her to wrap her arms around Dalton with glee, despite the obvious height differences between the two individuals. From there, Sakura began to tug on Dalton's arm to have him follow her, as she spoke toward him and said, "Come on, Dalton! I bet you'll like the food they got there." "...Well, I gotta admit, the place looks lively, Sakura." Dalton said, admitting that he was somewhat impressed by the lively scenery, since this was his first taste of Japanese culture. "*giggle* Glad you like it, Dalton. Come on, let's try out some of the games here!" Sakura replied, where she then dragged him further into the crowd, approaching some of the game stands in the process.

However, while they were resting, Dalton brought up a question for Sakura, as he spoke toward her and asked, "Sakura, can I ask you something?" "Of course, Dalton! You can ask me anything. So, what seems to be on your mind?" Sakura said, noticing that something was on the American's mind. Of course, the subject at hand was...

1112111112222112121131211111111.content:
"...Well, um... it's about what Sumire had mentioned earlier, about there already being a guy in the Flower Division. Is that true?" Dalton asked, wanting that one simple question answered. Inevitably, in response to such a question, Sakura exhaled a deep sigh before she spoke toward him and answered, "Actually, Dalton...there was already a man being in the Flower Division. His name...was Ichiro Ogami, and he was essentially our Commanding Officer." Of course, in all honesty, you weren't expecting such information from Sakura, revealing that Ogami was actually the leader of the Imperial Flower Troupe.

"...Okay, I...I was not expecting that, in all honesty, Sakura. So... what's he like?" Dalton asked, becoming curious as to what exactly Ichiro Ogami was like around Sakura and the others. Eventually, Sakura spoke once more toward the American and replied, "Ogami...he is an honest and honorable man. He deeply cares about his friends, and is willing to protect them, no matter the cost. In a way...I guess you could say that both you and him aren't so different."

"Yeah...except for the fact that I can transform into a 15 meter tall Titan. So...how come he's not here with you and the others when I arrived?" Dalton asked, wondering why Ichiro Ogami wasn't with Sakura and the other members of the Flower Division when he came into the picture. However, in response to such a reasonably valid question, Sakura then spoke toward Dalton and explained, "Well...it's kinda complicated. You see, he was sent out on a special mission to assist the Paris Assault Force in Paris, France. And from what we've read in his letters, they've been having some...difficulty, in stopping these "Kaijin", which means "Beast-Men". Commander Yoneda plans on sending several of us over to Paris to assist them in this manner. I was thinking that you should accompany us."

"Okay, so... let me get this straight, Sakura: Your C.O, Ichiro Ogami, is currently assisting this "Paris Assault Force" within the city of Paris, France. And for some reason, they're having trouble snuffing out these "Beast-Men". So now, Commander Yoneda wants you, me, and a few other members of the Flower Division to head over to Paris and lend them a hand. Correct?" Dalton said, summing up the overall information regarding to what sort of mission he and several members of the Flower Division would be participating in.

So, in response, Sakura nodded firmly in confirmation toward Dalton, where she then spoke toward him and replied, "Seems about right, Dalton." After some careful consideration on the current topic at hand, Dalton eventually decided to accept accompanying Sakura and a few other members of the Flower Division to visit Paris and lend assistance to Ogami and the Paris Assault Force, where he then spoke toward Sakura and answered, "...Eh, why the hell not? After all, I always wanted to visit the city of Paris, anyway."
1112111112222112121131211111111.title: Ichiro Ogami

13.content:
So, you decided to choose Star Division, hmm? Not a problem. After all, the game that they first made their debut in, Sakura Wars 5: So Long, My Love, was translated into English for Western audiences. Now, to give more info about Star Division, allow me to elaborate:

Formed in 1928 with Michael Sunnyside as its commander, The New York Combat Revue differs from the other organizations in that their assault team is referred to as the Star Division. Two members of the original disbanded Star Division were transferred to this group. Originally, Ratchet Altair was the captain of the squad, but her failing spiritual power led her to give the position to Lieutenant Shinjiro Taiga, while she assumed the role of vice commander. Gemini Sunrise, Cheiron Archer, Diana Caprice, Rosita Aries, and Subaru Kujo form the rest of the team.

As for support, there is the Rainbow Division, which is composed of Cherry Cocker and Anri Yoshino, providing Star Division with the necessary support during combat. Wong Xingzhi functions as the mechanical chief for Star Division. Their base of operations is located within the Little Lip Theater, which is located on Broadway, where the members of Star Division work undercover as actors and performers, fulfilling a similar role as Flower Division.

info.description:
Here it is, ladies and gentlemen! The first Sakura Wars-focused interactive story.

For those who are unfamiliar with this franchise, Sakura Wars is a series of dramatic fantasy and science-fantasy tactical role-playing adventure video games, which consist of tactical wargame and dating sim elements, but also includes it's own motion picture, anime, manga, and other merchandise. It takes place in an alternate 1920s Tokyo, New York City, and Paris, and follows the adventures of an all-female secret task forces in these 3 countries, with the Imperial Assault Force–Flower Division in Tokyo, the Paris Assault Force in Paris, and the New York Combat Revue–Star Division in New York City. Each assault force uses a special type of steam and spirit-powered armor to combat against evil inhuman entities.

Now that you know what the Sakura Wars franchise is about, here are the rules:

1. Female Characters only! That means you cannot date any of the other male characters like Ichiro Ogami or Shinjiro Taiga.

2. No gross stuff, but violence and some gore could be included.

3. No killing off the Main Character (You), or the girl of your choice.

4. If you have sex with said character, please give us a warning.

5. If you plan on giving your character a name, don't plagiarize.

6. Due to a few certain members of each assault force being possibly under the age of 18, I will be having said members be at LEAST the age of 18 years old. For good reasons, of course.

7. Just to add some variety, there will be an option to allow your character to have powers, including a few powers from different anime like Attack on Titan or Dragon Ball Z.

8. I would like it if you had the dialogue for the characters to be in different colors please. To make it a little easier to read for the viewers.

9. Go into detail when writing and adding new chapters, please don't go into writing a single sentence and just leave it at that.

10. Have Fun!
